prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: Dust continuum observation (high resolution)
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: We aim to detect the dust continuum at 350GHz of the [OIII] emitters at z>3. With the high resolution observations, we will be able to identify individual star-forming regions within each galaxy.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: We aim to observe continuum at 350GHz, and therfore we request TDM.

We request 0.14" angular resolution, which is accomplished by the C36-5 configuration at Band-7. The angular resolution of 0.14" corresponds to ~ 1.0 kpc at z=3.17. The sizes of our targets are ~2.8 kpc, and we will be able to sufficiently resolve their internal structures with 0.14" angular resolution.
The sizes of our targets are smaller than 1.0", and they are much smaller than the maximum recoverable scale of 2.2" in C36-5 configuration.

Our targets are 4 [OIII] emitters (O3Es) at z=3.2 and 3.6. The feasibility is estimated based on the previous study about the sub-mm properties of Lyman break galaxies (LBGs) at z~3 (Coppin et al. 2014). They performed stacking analysis to measure the average 850um fulx density of LBGs at <z>~3.35 in the UDS field using data from the SCUBA-2. Their LBG sample at <z>~3.35 covers the similar stellar mass renges with our sample (~1e10Msun). The average 850um flux density per galaxy is S850um ~ 0.25+-0.03 mJy. We adopt this value as the expected flux density at 350GHz for our sample. Based on the offical ALMA sensitivity calculator, we can reach to the limiting flux density 10sigma=0.25mJy with 1.0 hours on-source integration with Band-7 (350GHz). When more than half of this expected flux is emitted from the central dusty regions, we can detect the regions with more than 5sigma, and this is sufficient to achieve our science goal.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: Dust continuum observation (low resolution)
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: We aim to obtain the total flux at 350 GHz emitted from an entire galaxy with lower angular resolution observatios. We request 1.0" angular resolution.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: We aim to observe continuum at 350GHz, and therefore we request TDM.

The requested angular resolution is 1.0", which is accomplished by the C36-1 configuration at Band-7, to observe the total flux from a whole galaxy. Our targets are smaller than 1.0" angular scale, and also their sizes are much smaller than the maximum recoverable scale of 7.3" in the C36-1 configuration.

The feasibility is estimated in the same manner as the observation with high angular resolution. The expected flux density at 350GHz is S350GHz ~ 0.25 mJy. According to the official ALMA sensitivity calculator, we can reach the limiting fulx density of 5sigma=0.25mJy with 16 min integration in Band-7 (350GHz). We aim to measure the total flux from an entire galaxy with this low resolution observation, and S/N~5 is sufficient to achieve this goal.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract:
We propose dust continuum observations (350GHz) of [OIII] emission line galaxies at z>3, which have been obtained through a narrow-band imaging survey in SXDF-UDS-CANDELS field with Subaru. We select four [OIII] emitters with relatively high stellar masses and large sizes from our sample as the ALMA targets for sufficient feasibilities. We aim to obtain their sub-mm images with both high and low angular resolutions so that we can identify individual dusty star-forming regions within galaxies and obtain total IR fluxes emitted from an entire galaxy.
By comparing the rest-frame FIR images by ALMA with the HST images, we will be able to identify where the dusty star formation is occurring in these systems at z>3, and to measure the compactness of dusty-star-forming regions. These results will tell us what physical mechanisms are responsible for triggering the accelerated star formation activities at this epoch. In paticular, we will focus on the identification of compact star-forming galxies which must commonly exist at z>>2 as the progenitors of more massive, compact, and quiescent galaxies frequently seen at later times (z~2).
prp:ObsProposal.prp:scientificCategoryString: Cosmology and the High Redshift Universe
